The three gates of Juheulgwan, Jogokgwan, and Joryeonggwan were built for national defence after the Imjin War (1592-1598). These three gates are designated collectively as Historic Site No. 147. The area between the three gates was designated a provincial park in 1981. The path from the first gate to the last passes through beautiful forests and takes roughly four hours round-trip. Also located within the park boundaries is Mungyeongsaejae Open Set, used for filming historical dramas. ## Intro | | | | - | - | |infocenter:|‚Ä¢ 1330 Travel Hotline: +82-2-1330

data.title: Mungyeongsaejae Provincial Park (Î¨∏Í≤ΩÏÉàÏû¨ÎèÑÎ¶ΩÍ≥µÏõê)
data.description: Mungyeongsaejae Pass, which crosses Joryeongsan Mountain, has always been the highest and most dangerous mountain pass in Korea, being reputed to be too tall for even birds to fly over. The three gates of Juheulgwan, Jogokgwan, and Joryeonggwan were built for national defence after the Imjin War (1592-1598). These three gates are designated collectively as Historic Site No. 147. The area between the three gates was designated a provincial park in 1981. The path from the first gate to the last passes through beautiful forests and takes roughly four hours round-trip. Also located within the park boundaries is Mungyeongsaejae Open Set, used for filming historical dramas.
data.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Jikjisa Temple (ÏßÅÏßÄÏÇ¨)
dataList.description: Jikjisa Temple, located at the foot of Hwangaksan Mountain in Gimcheon, Gyeongsangbuk-do, was constructed in 418, during the second year of Silla Kingdom King Nuljis reign. This temple is in perfect harmony with the nearby valley and pine forest. The foliage in fall is particularly breathtaking. The temple grounds include Birojeon Hall (also known as Cheonbuljeon Hall), in which approximately 1,000 Buddha statues are enshrined, along with a thousand-year-old arrowroot. The templegrounds also include Iljumun Gate, Daeungjeon Hall, and a 1.63 meter-tall Seated Stone Buddhist Statue (Treasure No. 319) from the Unified Silla Period.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Jeolgolgyegok Valley [National Geopark] (Ï†àÍ≥®ÌòëÍ≥° (Ï≤≠ÏÜ° Íµ≠Í∞ÄÏßÄÏßàÍ≥µÏõê))
dataList.description: Jeolgolgyegok Valley is located along the mountain ridgeline connecting Gamebong Peak and Wanggeoam Rock in Juwangsan Mountain. It stretches for 5 kilometers from Jeolgol Valley Visitors Center to Daemun Bridge. The valley is formed of vocanic tuffs that were welded and compacted after cooling down, which resulted in forming vertical cracks, leaving rocks to fall out and create a steep valley cliff.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Huibangpokpo Falls (Ìù¨Î∞©Ìè≠Ìè¨)
dataList.description:
The 28-meter high Huibangpokpo Falls is a waterfall located below Huibangsa Temple on Sobaeksan Mountain in Sucheol-ri, Yeongju-si, Gyeongsangbuk-do. It is located 700 meters above sea level about halfway up Sobaeksan Mountain. It is one of the must-see attractions on Sobaeksan Mountain, and is the No.1 waterfall in the whole Yeongnam (southeastern part of Korea) area.

The water from the falls comes from Yeonhwabong Peak (1383 m), one of the sacred peaks of Sobaeksan Mountain. The water flows along the Huibanggyegok Valley and then plunges into the rocks below with a big splash, creating a breathtaking view for visitors.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Hakgasan Recreational Forest (ÌïôÍ∞ÄÏÇ∞ÏûêÏó∞Ìú¥ÏñëÎ¶º)
dataList.description: Hakgasan Recreational Forest is located in a valley on the northern side of Hakgasan Mountain, known for its clean air. The recreational forest has log cabins that harmonize with the nearby trees, creeks, and rocks, making visitors feel as if they are resting at a luxury villa. It is an ideal vacation destination for those who want to get closer to nature. There is a hiking path leading to the summit of Hakgasan Mountain from the forest, taking around 2 hours. Additional amenities within the forest include campfire pits, an outdoor stage, childrens playground, exercise equipment, water play area, a lecture hall, and more.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Gyeongju Daereungwon Ancient Tomb Complex (Í≤ΩÏ£º ÎåÄÎ¶âÏõê ÏùºÏõê)
dataList.description: Gyeongju Daereungwon Tomb Complex consists of five tombs, Ancient Tombs of Gyeongju Nodong-ri, Noseo-ri, Hwangnam-ri, Hwango-ri, and Inwang-ri. The tombs are distributed in Hwangnam-dong, Gyeongju-si, and are located in the Daereungwon area. Within Daereungwon Tomb Complex is Cheonmachong Tomb, which was excavated in 1973. Furthermore, Hwangnamdaechong Tomb was excavated between 1973 and 1975, and are twin tombs belonging to a presumed married couple.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Goraebul Beach (Í≥†ÎûòÎ∂àÌï¥ÏàòÏöïÏû•)
dataList.description: Goraebul Beach is located in Yeongdeok, Gyeongsangbuk-do. Its fine white sands stretch for 8 kilometers giving way to clean seawaters, and it is shaded by a pine forest. The beach has various facilities for visitors comfort including shower stalls, restroom, drinking fountain, snack bar and parking lot. Nearby tourist attractions include Wijeong Mineral Spring and Jangyuksa Temple. In Goesi-ri, there are many ancient buildings that can be seen throughout the area. Roughly 30 houses that are approximately 200 years old line the coastal drive. National Road number 7 heading north showcases almost all of the famous tourist attractions that line the East Sea.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Gayasan National Park (Baegundong Area) (Í∞ÄÏïºÏÇ∞Íµ≠Î¶ΩÍ≥µÏõê-Î∞±Ïö¥Îèô ÏßÄÍµ¨)
dataList.description: Gayasan Mountain in Gyeongsangbuk-do was designated as a national park in 1972. The mountains main peak, Chilbulbong Peak, towers at 1,433 meters. It borders Seongju-gun, Hapcheon-gun and Geochang-gun. In particular, the mountain range stretching along Suryun-myeon, Seongju-gun is famous for its scenic nature. Furthermore, the beautiful Gayasan Beltway, which extends from Suryun-myeon to Gayasan Mountain, highlights the splendor and grandeur of the precipitous crimson cliffs.
dataList.author: korea-tour
